questions.question_text: Of the following, who is responsible for approval when a change in an application system is ready for release to production?

An organization’ s recovery team is attempting to recover critical data backups following a major flood in its data center. However, key team members do not know exactly what steps should be taken to address this crisis. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of this situation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Failure to test the disaster recovery plan (DRP)

Selected Answer: A
Selected A. The situation seems like a training issue. Testing of DRP is a form of training and exposure to the process.
A. failure to test the DRP. by testing the DRP, everyone would know the proper procedures to be done to recover their data

A - A. Failure to test the disaster recovery plan (DRP) is the most likely cause of key team members not knowing exactly what steps should be taken to recover critical data backups following a major flood in the data center. Testing a disaster recovery plan (DRP) helps to ensure that the plan is effective and that all team members are familiar with their roles and responsibilities in the event of a disaster. By failing to test the DRP, an organization may not have a clear understanding of what needs to be done to recover critical data backups, leading to confusion and delays in the recovery process. Other causes, such as a lack of well-documented business impact analysis (BIA) or significant changes in management personnel, may also contribute to the situation, but failure to test the DRP is the most likely cause. Lack of annual updates to the DRP is not directly related to the situation described.
In my opinion, B sounds more appropriate.

choices.A: Failure to test the disaster recovery plan (DRP)
choices.D: Lack of annual updates to the disaster recovery plan (DRP)
choices.B: Lack of well-documented business impact analysis (BIA)
